messages.subject: Re: Indy Children's museum
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 7/19/99 5:04:39 PM Eastern Daylight Time, diasberry@hotmail.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/19/99 5:04:39 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
diasberry@... writes:

<< And I've just got to put my 2 cents in about the Museum: IT'S WICKED
AWESOME! >>

And the clock.....we have pictures (several) of that clock....the kids stood
and watched it forever...had to keep telling them to come on...there was a
whole museum to see!!

Sam

messages.subject: Re: Indy Children's museum
messages.msgSnippet: PS: Richie Woods is a nature preserve...not your typical park It s great for older kids--not very stroller friendly, although their trails have wood chips.
messages.messageBody:
PS: Richie Woods is a nature preserve...not your typical "park"
It's great for older kids--not very stroller friendly, although their trails
have wood chips. Members are free; fee's (i think) are $1 per person.

And I've just got to put my 2 cents in about the Museum: IT'S WICKED
AWESOME! That's one of the major things I miss. Portsmouth NH has a
Children's Museum, but in no way measures up to Indys. Yes, it's not cheap.
But for 5 stories of jam-packed exhibits of the highest quality... (they
need to do a two day pass or something--I've seen many a family practically
drag the kids from one exhibit to the other, trying to get it all in)
Not to snub my nose at the one here in NH, but when other Children's Museums
are located in an old house with only a handfull of exhibits--wow, I've
realized how good a museum Indy has...
(do I sound a little "homesick" for the museum?!)

Diana
"the world is our classroom"


----Original Message Follows----
From: "Diana Asberry" <diasberry@...>
Reply-To: Unschooling-dotcom@onelist.com
To: Unschooling-dotcom@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Indy Children's museum
Date: Mon, 19 Jul 1999 13:50:11 PDT

From: "Diana Asberry" <diasberry@...>

Richie Woods is the Children's Museum's nature "park". It's northeast of
downtown off I-69 at 96th st exit... They have a few hiking trails, a
shelter and two teepee frames. My eldest has gone to their summer camps
there and I rate their camps and personnel practically a 10. Make sure you
take Mosquito repellant!!!!

Diana A.
"the world is our classroom"
living in NH; keeping residency (a house) in IN--much less red tape for
HSing than in NH


----Original Message Follows----
From: fuerst@...
Reply-To: Unschooling-dotcom@onelist.com
To: Unschooling-dotcom@onelist.com
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Indy Children's museum
Date: 19 Jul 1999 13:21:05 -0000

From: fuerst@...

Ann,
John is right about the museum....I think it's rated tops in the country.
We have been members for the past five years - even though we live almost
two hours away!!
The museum is open until 5 p.m. most days. I think thet are closed on
Mondays. Also, they have a park somewhere north of Indy....can't remember
the name or much about it. We have not been there, but the literature on
it looks great.
Try their website....
http://a1.com/children/home.html

Susan
